bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Merritte W. Ireland, August 5, 1925

div1.p: Kean discusses Gorgas and the yellow fever work in Cuba. Ireland responds in a note at the bottom of the letter.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Merritte W. Ireland, August 5, 1925
div1.p:
MILITARY SURGEONS OF THE UNITED STATES
THE MILITARY SURGEON
WASHINGTON, D. C.
Aug 5th 1925 PRESIDENT
SURGEON GENERAL HUGH S. CUMMING
UNITED STATES PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
FIRST VICE-PRESIDENT
REAR ADMIRAL E. R. STITT
SURGEON GENERAL UNITED STATES NAVY
SECOND VICE-PRESIDENT
MAJOR GENERAL M. W. IRELAND
SURGEON GENERAL UNITED STATES ARMY
THIRD VICE-PRESIDENT
COL. FREDERICK H. VINUP
MEDICAL CORPS, MARYLAND NATIONAL GUARD

ADDRESS ALL COMMUNICATIONS TO
THE SECRETARY-TREASURER
COL. JEFFERSON R. KEAN, U.S. ARMY, RET.
EDITOR
ARMY MEDICAL MUSEUM AND LIBRARY
SEVENTH AND B STREETS S. W.
WASHINGTON, D. C.
ASSISTANT SECRETARY-TREASURER
MAJOR EDGAR ERSKINE HUME, M.C., U.S. ARMY

Here is a letter from Dr. Mazyck
P. Ravenel in answer to me I wrote him
with reference to his review of the
Gorgas Life in the Am. Pub. Health
Journal- I am sure that some of the
things he says will interest you-

This is fine and Willies
I have enjoyed it immensely.
has tried it. You may remember
that Mazyck was one of Willie's
party that started to Romania.
He surely has Gorgas sized up
Thank you
